alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Kemper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 7:44PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Newton, southwestern Kemper, northern Clarke and Lauderdale Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 744 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Martin to Snell. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Middleton and Sable around 800 PM CDT. Duffee around 805 PM CDT. Little Rock around 810 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
